sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Console-tools package contains the charset, chvt, consolechars, deallocvt, dumpkeys, fgconsole, fix_bs_and_del, font2psf, getkeycodes, kbd_mode, loadkeys, loadunimap, mapscrn, mk_modmap, openvt, psfaddtable, psfgettable, psfstriptable, resizecons, saveunimap, screendump, setfont, setkeycodes, setleds, setmetamode, setvesablank, showcfont, showkey, splitfont, unicode_start, unicode_stop, vcstime, vt-is-URF8, writevt

sect3.title: charset
sect3.para: charset sets an ACM for use in one of the G0/G1 charsets slots.

sect3.title: consolechars
sect3.para: consolechars loads EGA/VGA console screen fonts, screen font maps and/or application-charset maps.

sect3.title: fgconsole
sect3.para: fgconsole prints the number of the active virtual terminal.

sect3.title: getkeycodes
sect3.para: getkeycodes prints the kernel scancode-to-keycode mapping table.

sect3.title: kbd_mode
sect3.para: kbd_mode reports or sets the keyboard mode.

sect3.title: openvt
sect3.para: openvt starts a program on a new virtual terminal.

sect3.title: psfaddtable
sect3.para: psfaddtable adds a Unicode character table to a console font.

sect3.title: psfgettable
sect3.para: psfgettable extracts the embedded Unicode character table from a console font.

sect3.title: psfstriptable
sect3.para: psfstriptable removes the embedded Unicode character table from a console font.

sect3.title: resizecons
sect3.para: resizecons changes the kernel idea of the console size.

sect3.title: setkeycodes
sect3.para: setkeycodes loads kernel scancode-to-keycode mapping table entries.

sect3.title: setmetamode
sect3.para: setmetamode defines the keyboard meta key handling.

sect3.title: showcfont
sect3.para: showcfont displays all character in the current screenfont.

sect3.title: showkey
sect3.para: showkey examines the scancodes and keycodes sent by the keyboard.

sect3.title: unicode_start
sect3.para: unicode_start puts the console in Unicode mode.

sect3.title: vt-is-UTF8
sect3.para: vt-is-UTF8 checks whether the current virtual terminal is in UTF8- or byte-mode.
